goals.question: What is the overall trend of unemployment across industries?
goals.visualization: Line chart showing the trend of unemployment rate across industries over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the industries that have been most affected by unemployment over time.

goals.question: Which industry has the highest unemployment rate?
goals.visualization: Bar chart showing the unemployment rate for each industry
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the industry that has the highest unemployment rate and can be used to focus on the areas that need more attention.

goals.question: What is the distribution of unemployment rate across industries?
goals.visualization: Histogram showing the distribution of unemployment rate across industries
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the range of unemployment rate across industries and can be used to identify the industries that have a higher concentration of unemployment rate.

goals.question: What is the correlation between unemployment rate and industry size?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot showing the relationship between unemployment rate and industry size
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is any correlation between the size of the industry and the unemployment rate. It can be used to identify if the larger industries have a lower unemployment rate.

goals.question: What is the average unemployment rate across industries?
goals.visualization: Box plot showing the distribution of unemployment rate across industries
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the median and range of unemployment rate across industries. It can be used to identify the industries that have a higher or lower unemployment rate compared to the average.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='unemployment_rate', hue='industry', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the overall trend of unemployment across industries?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.legend(title='Industry', loc='upper left')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.barplot(x='industry', y='unemployment_rate', data=data)
    max_unemployment_rate = data['unemployment_rate'].max()
    plt.axhline(y=max_unemployment_rate, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Highest Unemployment Rate: {max_unemployment_rate:.2f}')
    plt.title('Which industry has the highest unemployment rate?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Industry')
    plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='unemployment_rate', kde=True, bins=20)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of unemployment rate across industries?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend(['Density'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='industry_size', y='unemployment_rate', hue='industry_name')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between unemployment rate and industry size?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Industry Size')
    plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.legend(title='Industry', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
    ax = sns.boxplot(x='industry', y='unemployment_rate', data=data)
    ax.set_title('What is the average unemployment rate across industries?', wrap=True)
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
    plt.legend(title='Industries', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
